name: The Cove Cornwall

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are impeccable, the rooms delightul, the restaurant cosy and romantic and the sauna was most welcome after walking from Sennen Cove that morning. If I could change one thing it would be more sun on arrival as we didn't get to try the pool. Bread, cereals, butter, jams, milk await you in your room upon arrival. Fresh croissants and pains au chocolat are delivered to your room in the morning. Checkout time 12am instead of the usual 10am was also much appreciated.
reviews.title: Mmm, a nice sauna after a day's hard walking

reviews.text: Stayed one night with my husband and dog. Can't fault it! Staff were really lovely and welcoming, food was fantastic, we had dinner in our room because of the dog, room service was great and the view was so nice from our room (apartment 8). Very relaxed and felt well looked after. Highly recommend.
reviews.title: My new favourite!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Other reviewers have referred to their stays here using a KGB discount deal and we were the same. According to the hotel's standard tariff, the deal for an off-peak break is approximately half the usual rate and on this basis represents very good value for a hotel of this quality. Fact is we would not normally stay at a place like this because of the cost - there's usually a good B&B down the road where you will get much better value for money. That said one has to recognise the availability of facilities one would not get in your average B&B, notably the swimming pool and excellent in-house restaurant. Unfortunately last week was not the best for weather and the swimming pool cover remained in place although judging by the water temperature a swim would have been quite pleasant.
reviews.title: An enjoyable short break - at a discount

reviews.text: The apartments are spacious - ours (no. 2) a sleep 4 had a large living/dining/kitchen area with separate double bedroom. The kitchen was well equipped for self catering including fridge/freezer, dishwasher, oven and four ring hob. Included in the price is what they refer to as a "hot" breakfast. Don't get too excited as this is a couple of croissants and pain an chocolats (warmed) delivered to your room each morning. There was the usual tea, coffee plus two jars of cereal, bottled water and butter and spreads.
reviews.title: Nice wedding

reviews.text: A particular bonus is the restaurant which serves meals all day long but offers a set dinner (3 courses for £23) or a la carte. We had two dinners during our stay and enjoyed both, even though the choice is not huge and does not include a vegetarian option for main course. The KGB deal includes a free bottle of house wine ( I had a very acceptable Pinot Grigio) if you eat in.
reviews.title: wonderful position and setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for 4 nights in mid September and had a perfect break. The apartment was immaculate and well stocked with breakfast provisions (plus hot croissants delivered each morning). It was very comfortable and overlooked woodland with a glimpse of the sea. The pool was a pleasant temperature with an attractive terrace for sun bathing. Lamorna Cove is a short walk through the hotel gardens and the stunning SW coastal footpath is on your doorstep. We had an excellent trip to Macbeth at the Minack theatre, a day surfing at glorious Sennen Cove, a trip to Newlyn to buy very fresh crab and several othe visits around this lovely area. We had 2 delicious dinners at the hotel restaurant and ate well at nearby pubs on the other nights. The 300 year old Lamorna Wink pub is very close by and thoroughly recommended.
reviews.title: A lovely place to stay

reviews.text: Stopped for a cream tea - Sunday 9th September 2012 - pm- v quiet-only ourselves and another group of people.

Room clean and tidy, lovely pastries delivered every morning
reviews.title: Perfect for Children

reviews.text: Perfect for us (2 adults + 3 children) - apartment had its own garden with rabbits included. Good food in restaurant, excellent pastries delivered every morning. Staff very friendly. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: ideal family stay

reviews.text: It's the second time we have been to The Cove in August and our mistake this year was to book in the cottage. It was damp and not up to standard with the other apartments. We were told that they had problems when we arrived but this didn't help us much as they were full elsewhere.
reviews.title: OK but not as good as last year

reviews.text: Although there are some great members of staff, notably the housekeeper Avril and Wo , the children's organiser the general air was that they needed a good manager to sort it out.
reviews.title: Perfect break
Fabulous food at the Cove
reviews.text: It was a shame as The Cove can be fantastic but it just needs to raise its game and get back to the standards we saw the year before.

The Cove have responded to our feedback form in an adequate manner but we went all that way and were disappointed because the fundamentals are good and if they sort the management out we would recommend it again
reviews.title: Perfect week end away.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Three days of glorious sunshine and then a good Cornish gale. The Cove looked brilliant in both. We were in Apt 4 which felt a like being in a tree house. Fabulous view down the valley to the sea and at the level of the tree tops - something to see in a gale!! Staff all charming, nothing too much trouble for them and food glorious. Loved the convenience of a contintenatl breakfast in our own apt with warm crossants delivered to the door after a morning dip in the lovely pool. Would love to come back in winter too!
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave!

reviews.text: Our family of 4 (2 young boys) had an amazing time at the Cove. It's probably the best view we've ever had from a room. They really thought of everything, fresh croissants delivered each morning, a fully stocked fridge and very clean. The food was top notch. We had to drag the boys from the nicely heated pool. We can't wait to visit again!
reviews.title: Amazing Hotel and Spot!

reviews.text: Previous reviews convinced us to give this restaurant a try. After experiencing the aversion other establishments have to young children, we were pleased to see that children were positively welcomed here! I have never experienced this attitude towards children on the Continent. Our children are of an age where introducing them to a non-McDonalds / chain-restaurant environment is right, so, their disposition suited us fine!
reviews.title: The best culinary experience of our holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you use the online booking facility, I would immediately phone and make them aware of the booking. We got caught-out by this, as there was a conflict between live & online bookings. To be fair, they did try several times to contact us once the issue had been spotted, but we were out of coverage (mobile-wise). That said, if you're going to call them anyway, you might as well just book that way. From a process angle, management should ensure that online bookings aren't forgotten.
reviews.title: Well worth a return visit.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we turned up at the appointed time, we were informed of the issue. The staff kindly got us booked at another restaurant. As luck would have it, a no-show meant we could have our meal here anyway! Were we glad we did!
reviews.title: Dream wedding

description: Luxury holiday self catering accommodation with optional hotel services in Cornwall. Facilities include our outdoor heated pool, bar and terrace area, 4 acres of tropical gardens and Fireside Restaurant. All this in the beautiful Lamorna Valley and minutes away from the seaside
